descriptions.description: More core developers increase the availability of mentorship, facilitating implicit knowledge transfer.
A larger pool of potential mentors attracts more newcomers to join the project as contributors.
As new contributors skill up, they flow out of the 'New Contributors' stock into more experienced roles.
Developer turnover directly reduces the number of core developers as they leave the project.
A higher promotion rate increases the core developer stock by advancing experienced contributors.
Promoting experienced contributors to core developers reduces the stock of experienced contributors.
The skill-up flow increases the stock of experienced contributors by advancing new contributors.
Better documentation and guides accelerate skill development by providing accessible learning resources.
Effective mentorship accelerates skill acquisition by providing personalized guidance and support.
Strong mentorship increases promotion rates by preparing experienced contributors for core developer responsibilities.
